name: Ti Kaye Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from a week's stay at TiKaye for my 20th Wedding Anniversary.....having planned the trip for a year it would have been easy for my expectations to have exceeded reality - that was not the case.
reviews.title: A thoroughly relaxing week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Things to know before you book: All of these have been said before on TA and so were not a surprise to me but others have negatively reviewed based upon the following; yes there are steps to the beach (169), yes there is light weight hassle from vendors (but it's part of the experience), Tikaye's location is remote (but that's why I chose it) and the roads are not what you'd expect in the US, UK etc... (is that a bad thing? The standard of driving was ok and the road to TiKaye, while bumpy, was fine).
reviews.title: A delicious vacation (except for the food)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Resort: Beautiful - secluded, quiet and green. The evening frog chorus is loud but an essential part of the holiday. The views are glorious.
reviews.title: Wonderful honeymoon escape

likes.liked: — Service, views, food, value, bar drinks, beach
likes.disliked: — Water in bay gets busy with cruise tourists most late afernoons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an Ocean Front cottage with pool and during our week we stayed in Annaffe for 4 nights and Niche for 3. Annaffe is closest to the the pool and restaurant and was larger than Niche (more room on the deck and larger pool), it had a fabulous view of the beach so you had plenty to watch in the morning and evening. The only downside of Annaffe is that the final part of the spa complex (it's 3 buildings) does look onto the porch and so there is not total privacy. As work was ongoing during my stay there was some noise and more activity than normal and so I asked to be moved, the request was accommodated ASAP by Katie and we were moved to Niche. Niche is the furthest cottage from the main area and so was very quiet and secluded - the porch and pool are very slightly smaller and there appeared to be more insect activity (but still not a problem), In both cottages the coffee makers, IPOD compatible radio, fridge, hammock etc... all contributed to the cottages being very comfortable. There is very little to choose between the two cottages we stayed in, I preferred Niche and my wife Annaffe.
reviews.title: Very nice, beautiful resort

likes.disliked: — Dinner was a little formal for our taste, would have preferred a lmore relaxed atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: Breakfasts were fine, fruit, cereals, breads and of course freshly made omlettes. The beach bar food was good value and reasonable quality (cheese burgers were excellent). While the evening menu was not extensive (normally 3-4 main courses) we always found something that we liked and some evenings the food was good and some average (but always acceptable).
reviews.title: Still Thinking About Ti Kaye

likes.disliked: — Nothing....well maybe the drive to and from the airport...a little scary!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Awe-inspiring view! Our stay at Ti Kaye still comes up in conversations over a year and a half later. The cottage, with plunge pool (definitely worth it!), was well kept, private and provided both a romantic and beautiful view for us. Here's the great part: we stayed there during Hurricane Dean (which devastated much of the island) and their hospitality never ended. The staff was there for us through the night; when trees were blowing over, the staff was there with beer and food! WE NEVER LOST POWER THROUGH THE NIGHT (Though other, more expensive hotels-LADERA-were powerless and sent their residents to a motel!)!!! The next day, they recommended that we stay in our cottage (which was great anyway), while they cleaned up the mess! By the time we went to dinner that night, it didn't look like a hurricane had even been through that area! The food was gourmet and tasty! The staff was always on call and ready to help! We read on some posts before we came, that some people complained about the isolation of Ti Kaye! Granted, it is not a party spot near other resorts, but that's the beauty of it all!
reviews.title: Truly Hidden Gem!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Ladera for two days afterward and although lovely, for the price, Ti Kaye wins, hands down!, no question!
reviews.title: Awesome vacation in St. Lucia

likes.disliked: — Remote location - difficult to leave the property for meals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a week long vacation at Ti Kaye and had a great time.
reviews.title: Wonderful, Relaxing Resort

likes.liked: — The cottage community and the people
likes.disliked: — The time it could take to get places (so don't leave:)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in cottage F. I believe it was marked as ocean view, but there were no cottages in front of us, so we had a beautiful view of the beach, ocean and mountains. The rooms themselves are very nice/rustic feeling. They are spacious and clean. The front deck is big with a 2-person hammock and table and chairs - great for relaxing before dinner. Lizards/bugs do get into the rooms, so make sure to close the shutters and doors before it gets dark. Mosquito nets are also provided for the beds, but we didn't need it.
reviews.title: Loved Ti Kaye!!! Wonderful experience :)

likes.disliked: — If I have to pick something, I would say the stairs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: There had been some bad weather in the weeks before we got there, so the beach had gotten pretty rocky, but there were people cleaning it up, and within a day or 2 it was in good shape. There is great snorkeling right off the hotel beach. The water was really clear and calm. There are quite a few boats that come in during the day for snorkel or scuba trips, but for the most part the people don't come onto the beach, and we didn't find it disturbing at all. While we were there, Terry and George were working on the beach, and were super helpful if you wanted to take out the kayaks, get a drink, move the umbrella, anything. The only bad part of the beach is the bathroom, which isn't as nice as the other facilities.
reviews.title: Fabulous wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived, we were given first-class attention. Check-in was smooth and we were quickly shown to our room, which was lovely. We booked a Ocean View Room(One of the connected ones) through Orbitz, so I was a bit nervous. But, it was perfect--You could barely notice that someone is in the adjoining room, so it felt just as private to us.
reviews.title: Somewhere over the Rainbow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay lasted five days, on the fourth a Full Rainbow appeared across the sea in front of TiKaye. It was beautiful.
reviews.title: Had we known how great this place was...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were great, housekeeping did a great job, the food was great, and the snorkeling was wonderful.
reviews.title: True Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we might have stayed longer. All we wanted for the first few days of our honeymoon was sun, sand, relaxation and privacy. This resort was more than perfect for all those. We went during the "shoulder season" and felt like we had the place to ourselves. The staff remembered our names and were very friendly. We didn't have any bug problems (but I did douse the cottage with Skin So Soft when we arrived). For context: understand that I am from Florida, where the pace is a little slower, and grew up at beaches and pools. I also love trying exotic foods. I have been snorkeling in Key Largo and hiking in Hawaii. If you want a mini-version of these experiences (meaning that the mountains and reefs are smaller and less of them, but you also don't have to go very far to enjoy them here), you could stay for at least a week here and totally disconnect from the Blackberry addictions. And you can't beat the price. I loved every meal the chef prepared. Just keep in mind this is not a "swim up bar" kind of experience -- it's way more personal, way more intimate and you get more of the feel of the people of St. Lucia. LOVED the private plunge pool and garden shower and create-your-own mini bar. Plus the manager is a wonderful hostess. Our "love" cottage was bigger than my apartment. Every feature from the four poster, mosquito net canopy bed, to the hammock on the front porch over looking the ocean was a temptation to never leave the room. BTW - other resorts ship their snorkelers into this same beach so you might want to get your dip in before/after they leave, which is usually around 10 am and 2 pm. Try really hard to do nothing and enjoy it! If you must do activities other than snorkeling and lounging, do the wine tasting, and ask about local hiking trips. We hope to revisit this place!
reviews.title: we've been four times and it keeps getting better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Secluded, relaxed, tropical, and unique were the requirements for our honeymoon and we found it all at Ti Kaye Village. We enjoyed every second of our seven night stay. We opted for the ocean front cottage with a plunge pool and it far exceeded our expectations. We awoke everyday to the sunrise and sound of morning birds. We fell asleep every night to the ocean waves. The cottage had everything we needed; full walk-in closet, hammock, plunge pool with lounge chairs, huge bed, refrigerator and we loved the outdoor garden shower (very romantic). We had the honeymoon package which included breakfast everyday, snorkeling gear everyday, a couples massage, a private dinner, local fish fry, and sunset cruise. We enjoyed everything. The spa is a new addition to the resort and we highly recommend it. The massage tables overlook the ocean in an open air hut. We had ours at sunset and it was ultimate relaxation. We also really enjoyed the fish fry in Anse La Raye. It was nice to see some of the true local flavor of the island and taste what they had to offer. The staff was very welcoming and accommodating throughout our entire stay and really made us feel special, especially during our private dinner. We would absolutely recommend Ti Kaye Village and St. Lucia as a great get away for young couples and friends. We can't wait to return in the near future!
reviews.title: Most relaxing and romantic place I've ever been.

likes.disliked: — Taxi ride to and from airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at the airport at 4:00 Monday, June 23rd we were quick to find out that our travel agent (American Express; honeymoon division) only booked us tickets coming back from St. Lucia. Of course I was told that I had to do everything through my TA, and it was 1:00 in the morning in California where they are located. Luckily an American Airlines associate was able to get us on the same flights we were told we were booked on. We had just enough time to get through security grab some Starbucks and board our plane to Miami. When we got to Miami it sucked. We had a 3 hour layover which we thought wasn't that bad, but in the International wing of the airport there are only 3 places to eat; Chinese, pizza, or an au bon store where you can buy sandwiches an salads. Jon and I ate some pizza at 9am for fear that we would starve to death by the time we got to St. Lucia. Our flight to St. Lucia was ALL honeymooners, and about 90% were going to one of the three Sandals resorts on the island. The flight was long, but I slept most of the way, and Jon (my husband) watched shows on his ipod. They played 27 dresses on the plane which I found to be very ironic!
reviews.title: Rustic Honeymoon

likes.liked: — The wonderful snorkling, beach access, and breakfast buffet.
likes.disliked: — It was so secluded and there was hardly anything to do in the evening.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived in St. Lucia we had to wait in another long line to get through customs. After that we found our taxi driver and we left for the resort. He gave us cool towels and a bottle of water. Prior to our honeymoon I asked Jon to get us some Dramamine for the car trips. I do not get car sick what-so-ever, but after reading a ton of reviews and hearing it from friends who visited the island I wanted to be prepared. He told me he had Dramamine and when I went to open it to get some for the ride to Ti Kaye I only found one... So we decided to split it. About 30 minutes into our trip I was feeling so incredibly nausea that I had to close my eyes or I was going to loose my pizza from earlier that morning. I have never gotten car sick before, and I don't ever want too. From that point on I kept getting Dramamine from the front office before any car ride out of Ti Kaye. The road leading into Ti Kaye is just as bad as everyone says it is...
reviews.title: A perfect honeymoon..can't wait to go back!

likes.liked: — Amenities, cottages with ocean view and plunge pool, Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend recommended an amazing taxi driver, Noel... who can take you out to dinner or tour you around the island if needed. I would definitely go over to Ladera for dinner one evening while your staying at Ti Kaye... delish and such an amazing view of the Pitons! Pictures can not describe how incredible it was! Be ready for high priced taxi service! I think it cost us $120 for a taxi round trip to Ladera... but Noel also took us to the town of Soufrie where we went to the Botanical Garden, Waterfall, the Casava bread factory, etc.... totally worth it.
reviews.title: Great and memorable honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also got PADI certified during our honeymoon. We started off by taking a Discover Scuba dive on that Tuesday afternoon. Because our travel agency screwed up our flights going to St. Lucia they paid for our discover scuba diving course! We waited to pick up the PADI packets until the next day, becuase my ears were extremely hurting, and I wasn't sure if I was going to be able to go through with the course. On that Thursday we started working on our books. We only had to read 3 chapters, take the quizzes, and then we could do our last 3 dives for standard certification. This was great, but I felt like half of our honeymoon we were studying. Which was probably a good thing because we never have the time at home to work on getting certified!
reviews.title: Ti Kaye is great... but with some caveats

likes.liked: — Beautiful views, very private, with a large front porch and hammock.
likes.disliked: — While i liked being in a semi-open villa, and liked having lizards come visit indoors, others wildlife (roaches) came into our bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went zip lining which was a lot of fun, but very expensive... I want to say between the taxi and the actual zip lining it was like $340! mad expensive! It was a cool experience... if you have the money and time--do it! Noel took us to a drop off point where we met another bus of people that all mainly came from Marigot. Because it happened to be a day when the cruise lines were in they were super packed, and of course we were in the rain forest so it was constantly down pouring. Our driver took us all to a waterfall while the lines started to dwindle. It was really cool, although the waterfall was very small and barely produced any movement. We got to walk around the rocks, and take a ton of pictures. I'm so happy we had a waterproof digital camera for our trip. That's the main reason why we were able to document so much of our trip!
reviews.title: Overpriced!

description: Overlooking Anse Cochon Bay Ti Kaye Resort & Spa is located on the serene West Coast and is simply known as Ti Kaye, (which means small house in the native creole patois language of Saint Lucia). With only 33 rooms, the Kai Koko Spa and a 460 bin 'Wine Kave' there is no better place to find romantic relaxation - combined with the best snorkeling bay to be found aywhere on St. Lucia.
